## Mean Centring

```{r, results='asis',echo=FALSE}
cat('Mean centring is a common and usually necessary step prior to multivariate modelling. It removes any offset differences between the the features and allows us to explore variation from the mean, rather than from zero.')

if (MS$mode=='data') {
    cat('For this dataset the columns of the data matrix were mean centred.')
} else if (MS$mode=='sample_meta') {
    cat('For this dataset the sample meta data was mean centred.')
} else if (MS$mode=='both') {
    cat('For this dataset both the data matrix and the sample meta data were mean centred.')
}
```
